00030 /*
00031  * svc_auth_nodes.c, Server-side rpc authenticator interface,
00032  * *WITHOUT* DES authentication.
00033  *
00034  * Copyright (C) 1984, Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  */
00036 
00037 #include "Rpc.h"
00038 
00039 /*
00040  * svcauthsw is the bdevsw of server side authentication. 
00041  * 
00042  * Server side authenticators are called from authenticate by
00043  * using the client auth struct flavor field to index into svcauthsw.
00044  * The server auth flavors must implement a routine that looks  
00045  * like: 
00046  * 
00047  *      enum Auth_stat
00048  *      flavorx_auth(rqst, msg)
00049  *              register struct Svc_req *rqst; 
00050  *              register struct Rpc_msg *msg;
00051  *
00052  */
00053 
00054 enum Auth_stat Svcauth_none();          /* no authentication */
00055 enum Auth_stat Svcauth_unix();          /* unix style (uid, gids) */
00056 enum Auth_stat Svcauth_short(); /* short hand unix style */
00057 enum Auth_stat Svcauth_gss();           /* RPCSEC_GSS */
00058 
00059 static struct {
00060         enum Auth_stat (*authenticator)();
00061 } Svcauthsw[] = {
00062         { Svcauth_none },               /* AUTH_NONE */
00063         { Svcauth_unix },               /* AUTH_UNIX */
00064         { Svcauth_short },              /* AUTH_SHORT */
00065         { Svcauth_none },               /* AUTH_DES - does not exist */
00066         { Svcauth_none },
00067         { Svcauth_none },
00068         { Svcauth_gss }         /* RPCSEC_GSS */
00069 };
00070 #define AUTH_MAX        6               /* HIGHEST AUTH NUMBER */
00071 
00072 /*
00073  * The call rpc message, msg has been obtained from the wire.  The msg contains
00074  * the raw form of credentials and verifiers.  authenticate returns AUTH_OK
00075  * if the msg is successfully authenticated.  If AUTH_OK then the routine also
00076  * does the following things:
00077  * set rqst->rq_xprt->verf to the appropriate response verifier;
00078  * sets rqst->rq_clntcred to the "cooked" form of the credentials.
00079  *
00080  * NB: rqst->rq_xprt->verf must be pre-alloctaed;
00081  * its length is set appropriately.
00082  *
00083  * The caller still owns and is responsible for msg->u.cmb.cred and
00084  * msg->u.cmb.verf.  The authentication system retains ownership of
00085  * rqst->rq_clntcred, the cooked credentials.
00086  *
00087  * There is an assumption that any flavour less than AUTH_NONE is
00088  * invalid.
00089  */
00090 enum Auth_stat Svc_authenticate(register struct Svc_req *  rqst,        struct Rpc_msg * msg )
00091 {
00092         register int cred_flavor;
00093 
00094         rqst->rq_cred = msg->rm_call.cb_cred;
00095         rqst->rq_xprt->xp_verf.oa_flavor = _null_auth.oa_flavor;
00096         rqst->rq_xprt->xp_verf.oa_length = 0;
00097         cred_flavor = rqst->rq_cred.oa_flavor;
00098         
00099         if ((cred_flavor <= AUTH_MAX) && (cred_flavor >= AUTH_NONE)) {
00100                 return ((*(Svcauthsw[cred_flavor].authenticator))(rqst, msg ));
00101         }
00102 
00103         return (AUTH_REJECTEDCRED);
00104 }
